subject: Re: [junit] testing collections
msgSnippet: ... Java Collection objects support the .equals() method, which is what assertEquals() uses. -- Chris electric hedgehog Dollin
messageBody:
On Thursday 27 January 2005 16:12, Soaring Eagle wrote:
> The lines of code:
> > Collection generatedRecipients = broker.getRecipients();
> > assertEquals("Wrong recipients",expectedValues,generatedRecipients);
>
> indicate that you could compare two Collections in junit. I do not see
> that signature in the junit version that i am using... I can see
> assertEquals(Object, Object), but that may not help...

Java Collection objects support the .equals() method, which is what
assertEquals() uses.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
